column4: I get boot error "Selected cylinder exceeds maximum supported by bios" when trying to boot ubuntu after installing opensuse on seperate disk, ehich overwrote the grub2 on my primary disk to include  opensuse (on the seperate disk) i do not really want to write a /boot partition earlier in the disk can i restore the old grub and be able to boot ubuntu
boot a live CD, run sudo grub-install /dev/sd<letter>
I'm not really sure what it will do
I think it will do everything auto-magically
